alert.note: Alert for Clay; East Marshall; East Polk; Kittson; Norman; Pennington; Red Lake; Roseau; West Marshall; West Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 09 at 1:49PM CST until March 12 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Minnesota. * WHEN...From late Friday night through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow may develop Friday evening and continue through Saturday. Increasing southeast winds may lead to whiteout conditions while snow is falling. There will be a break in winds as snow ends late Saturday, but then northerly winds increase once again with additional blowing snow impacts possible Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Clay; East Marshall; East Polk; Kittson; Norman; Pennington; Red Lake; Roseau; West Marshall; West Polk
